item.title: 中国多年减持美国国债预示更大风险
item.description: 中国最新表态称将削减持有的美国国债后，美债价格短暂下跌，但这凸显了北京方面十年来逐步减少美国债务的趋势，并重新引发了市场对全球范围内大规模撤资的担忧。【原文：The slump in Treasuries after China’s latest call to curb its holdings was fleeting, but it put a spotlight on Beijing’s decade-long shift from US debt and rekindled fears about a broader, global retreat.】

item.title: 华尔街的新交易策略是抛售任何被人工智能瞄准的股票
item.description: 在华尔街，对人工智能日益增长的担忧持续重创那些可能被技术浪潮反噬的企业股价，从小型软件公司到大型财富管理机构皆未能幸免。【原文：On Wall Street, rising fears about artificial intelligence keep pummeling the shares of companies at risk of being caught on the wrong side of it all, from small software companies to big wealth-management firms.】

item.title: 英国金融科技融资额去年下降21%，创2020年以来新低
item.description: 去年英国金融科技领域的投资额暴跌逾20%，跌至新冠疫情暴发以来的最低水平。投资者因宏观经济风险而犹豫不决，纷纷转向美国市场寻求机遇。【原文：Investment in the UK financial technology world plummeted by more than 20% last year to the lowest levels since the start of the Covid-19 pandemic, as backers hesitated on macroeconomic risks and flocked to US opportunities.】

item.title: 油价上涨，因伊朗局势紧张盖过库存增加迹象
item.description: 油价上涨，因中东局势聚焦伊朗的紧张态势盖过了美国行业报告显示库存大幅增加的影响。【原文：Oil gained as tensions in the Middle East focused on Iran outweighed a US industry report that pointed to a big rise in stockpiles.】

item.title: 金价维持在5000美元上方，美国数据强化降息预期
item.description: 金价小幅上涨——在每盎司5000美元上方巩固涨幅——此前美国疲软的零售销售数据强化了美联储降息的理由。【原文：Gold rose modestly — consolidating gains above $5,000 an ounce — after weak retail sales in the US supported the case for the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates.】

item.title: 澳交所股价创两月最大跌幅，因首席执行官洛夫豪斯计划离职
item.description: 澳大利亚证券交易所有限公司股价下跌，此前该公司宣布深陷争议的首席执行官海伦·洛夫特豪斯将于5月离职，但未公布继任者人选。当前澳大利亚证券交易所正面临包括监管调查在内的多重挑战。【原文：ASX Ltd. shares declined after the company said embattled chief executive Helen Lofthouse will leave the role in May, without naming a successor as the Australian exchange grapples with challenges including a regulatory probe.】

item.title: 比特币鲸鱼再度买入，其他大买家纷纷撤离
item.description: 比特币刚刚获得部分最大持有者的新的支持，但需求的回归范围仍然相当有限，这令人质疑这究竟是复苏的信号，还是仅仅是损害控制的举措。【原文：Bitcoin has just drawn fresh support from some of its largest holders, though the return of demand remains narrow enough to raise doubts about whether it marks a recovery or mere damage control.】

item.title: 苏扎诺将因美元走弱而维持纸浆产量低于产能
item.description: 巴西苏扎诺公司首席执行官若昂·阿尔贝托·阿布雷乌表示，作为全球顶级纸浆出口商之一，该公司计划在2026年前保持低于满负荷的生产状态，因美元走弱正冲击其营收。【原文：Brazil’s Suzano SA, one of the world’s top exporters of pulp, plans to keep production below full capacity through 2026 as a weakening US dollar hurts revenue, Chief Executive Officer Joao Alberto Abreu said.】

item.title: 三星将于2月25日发布搭载人工智能技术的Galaxy S26系列智能手机
item.description: 三星电子将于2月25日在旧金山举办发布会，正式推出其最新主流Galaxy智能手机系列。此举旨在推动用户升级换代，并在与苹果iPhone及安卓阵营竞争对手的角逐中注入新动能。【原文：Samsung Electronics Co. will unveil its latest mainstream Galaxy smartphones on Feb. 25 at an event in San Francisco, hoping to spur upgrades and fresh momentum in its rivalry with Apple Inc.’s iPhone and Android-based competitors.】

item.title: 高盛印度战略在竞争激烈的华尔街市场初见成效
item.description: 正是在新德里泰姬陵酒店举行的罕见全球董事会会议上，高盛集团印度区负责人提出了变革主张。【原文：It was at a rare global board meeting in New Delhi’s Taj Mahal Hotel that Goldman Sachs Group Inc.’s India country head made the case for change.】

item.title: 亚洲股市有望延续涨势，美股走低：市场综述
item.description: 亚洲股市周三有望创下新高，而美国国债价格则因疲软的零售销售数据增强了美联储今年降息的可能性而上涨。【原文：Stocks in Asia were poised to advance to a fresh record on Wednesday, while Treasuries climbed after weak retail sales bolstered the case for the Federal Reserve to lower rates this year.】

item.title: 特朗普的炮舰外交使中国获得55万亿美元的经济优势
item.description:
唐纳德·特朗普将安全倡议的重心放在西半球和中东地区。亚洲仍是更具价值的影响力范围。

【原文：

Donald Trump has anchored his security initiatives in the Western Hemisphere and Middle East. Asia remains a far more valuable sphere of influence.

】

item.title: 马云支持的蚂蚁集团押注人工智能医疗领域，角逐690亿美元市场
item.description: 大约五年前，蚂蚁集团因首次公开募股受挫而收敛了野心。如今，这家由马云支持的企业正押注于截然不同的业务来推动下一阶段的增长：人工智能驱动的医疗健康。【原文：Roughly five years ago, Ant Group Co. reined in its ambitions after a derailed initial public offering. Today, the Jack Ma-backed company is betting on a very different business to fuel its next phase of growth: health care powered by artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 美泰股价暴跌，假日季业绩未达预期
item.description: 美泰公司股价在盘后交易中暴跌，此前这家玩具制造商公布的假日季业绩未达分析师预期，并发布了2026年利润下滑的预测。【原文：Mattel Inc. shares plunged in late trading after the toymaker reported holiday results that fell short of analysts’ estimates and issued a 2026 forecast for lower profit.】

item.title: 108美元石油之战：中东能让世界经济崩盘吗？
item.description: 半个世纪前，中东动荡曾令全球经济陷入瘫痪。如今，尽管该地区地缘政治日益动荡，石油市场和央行通常将冲突视为需密切关注的冲击——而非决定宏观前景的关键因素。1970年代式的能源危机似乎不会迫在眉睫。但若真爆发，其对通胀、增长和政策的影响将极为深远。【原文：Half a century ago, turmoil in the Middle East brought the global economy to its knees. Today, even as the region’s geopolitics grow more fractious, oil markets and central banks typically treat conflict as a shock to watch—not one that dictates the macro outlook. A 1970s-style energy crisis doesn’t look imminent. If it were to materialize, the consequences for inflation, growth and policy would be profound.】

item.title: 闪点：前言
item.description: 地缘政治断裂的代价已不再是假设。过去一年里，乌克兰爆发战争，中东战火纷飞，印巴交火，泰柬冲突，美国对伊朗和委内瑞拉实施打击，特朗普总统还试图在格陵兰岛进行土地掠夺。【原文：The price of geopolitical rupture is no longer hypothetical. The past year has seen war in Ukraine, war in the Middle East, war between India and Pakistan, war between Thailand and Cambodia, US strikes against Iran and Venezuela, and President Donald Trump’s attempted land grab in Greenland.】

item.title: 十万亿美元之战：模拟中美因台湾爆发战争
item.description: 这座处于人工智能浪潮中心——且日益成为全球经济枢纽——的岛屿，正处于地质与地缘政治的断层线上。作为全球多数先进半导体生产地，台湾正面临来自中国大陆日益加剧的压力，以及美国支持力度的不确定性。战争似乎尚未迫在眉睫，但若爆发，对全球经济的冲击将如同地震般剧烈。【原文：The island at the center of the artificial intelligence boom—and increasingly the global economy—lies on geological and geopolitical fault lines. Taiwan, the producer of most of the world’s advanced semiconductors, faces intensifying pressure from mainland China and growing uncertainty about US support. War doesn’t appear imminent. If it were to erupt, though, the shock to the global economy would be seismic.】

item.title: BCA Research警告：日元套利交易是"定时炸弹"
item.description: BCA Research分析师指出，日元套利交易如同"一枚定时炸弹"，这种广受欢迎的对冲基金策略极易遭遇大规模平仓。【原文：The carry trade in the yen is “a ticking time bomb,” with the popular hedge-fund strategy vulnerable to a massive unwind, according to BCA Research analysts.】

item.title: 期权交易员认为就业数据将锁定2026年两次或三次降息
item.description: 短期利率交易者正聚焦于一项押注，若美联储今年仅降息两到三次，该押注便能获利。【原文：Short-term interest-rate traders are coalescing around a bet that would pay off if the Federal Reserve cuts interest rates just two or three times this year.】

item.title: 巴西金融科技公司Agibank在美国IPO中筹集2.4亿美元
item.description: 据知情人士透露，巴西金融科技公司AGI Inc.周二早些时候缩减了美国首次公开募股的规模和价格区间后，最终募资2.4亿美元。【原文：Brazilian fintech AGI Inc. raised $240 million in a US initial public offering, according to a person familiar with the matter, after reducing the size and price range of the deal earlier Tuesday.】

item.title: 中银国际股价下跌11%，因上半年净利润低于预期
item.description: CSL有限公司股价下跌，此前这家澳大利亚生物科技公司公布上半年利润暴跌81%。在新任临时首席执行官接管公司之际，该公司正面临资产减记、疫苗市场疲软以及投资者信心持续多年下滑的困境。【原文：CSL Ltd. shares dropped after the Australian biotech posted an 81% drop in first-half profit, as a new interim chief executive officer takes charge amid asset write-downs, weaker vaccine markets and a years-long slide in investor confidence.】

item.title: Robinhood利润暴跌，年末加密货币暴跌拖累营收
item.description: 罗宾汉金融公司报告称，第四季度利润下滑，原因是比特币及其他加密货币价格的急剧下跌拖累了这家在线经纪商的业绩。【原文：Robinhood Markets Inc. reported lower fourth-quarter profit as sharp declines in Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies weighed on results at the online brokerage.】

item.title: Zillow盈利预期因房地产市场降温及法律成本而落空
item.description: Zillow集团公司预测第一季度利润将低于分析师预期，因这家房产搜索网站需同时承担持续诉讼产生的法律费用及与Redfin合作产生的支出。【原文：Zillow Group Inc. forecast first-quarter profit that falls short of analyst estimates as the home-search site balances legal costs from ongoing litigation and expenses from the company’s partnership with Redfin.】

item.title: Lyft盈利预期未达标，意外录得运营亏损
item.description: Lyft公司第四季度意外录得1.85亿美元的运营亏损，并发布了令人失望的年初盈利预测，这表明其全球扩张和新产品推出可能在短期内拖累利润。【原文：Lyft Inc. posted a surprise $185 million operating loss in the fourth quarter and issued a disappointing earnings forecast for the start of the year, a sign that its global expansion and new product offerings may weigh on profits in the short term.】

item.title: 日本高市早苗巩固权力——但她能兑现承诺吗？
item.description:
高市早苗的选举豪赌终获回报。如今，执政的现实考验才刚刚开始。今日《亚洲焦点》将深入剖析首相对日本的愿景，以及其雄心勃勃的施政纲领将面临的重重挑战。

【原文：

Sanae Takaichi’s election gamble paid off. Now, the reality of governing begins. On today’s Big Take Asia: Unpacking the prime minister’s vision for Japan and hurdles ahead for her ambitious agenda.

】

item.title: 联邦银行利润超预期，商业贷款业务表现亮眼
item.description: 澳大利亚联邦银行上半年利润超出预期，得益于其旗舰抵押贷款业务的增长以及对企业贷款的积极推动。【原文：Commonwealth Bank of Australia’s first-half profit topped estimates, buoyed by growth in its flagship mortgage business and a push in lending more to companies.】

item.title: 债券交易商推高私募信贷基金交易成本，软件价格持续下滑
item.description: 华尔街交易商正要求提高交易私募信贷基金所发企业债券的佣金，因投资者对这些基金投资于面临人工智能颠覆的软件公司感到不安。【原文：Wall Street dealers are demanding higher compensation to trade corporate bonds issued by private credit funds, as investors turn squeamish about the funds’ exposure to software firms facing artificial intelligence disruption.】

item.title: 纽约私立学校初创企业通过提供42%学费折扣寻求竞争优势
item.description: 在纽约哈罗国际学校于九月开学前，校长马修·西普尔曾希望首学年能招收80名学生。然而目前仅有20名学生入学，而26名教职员工的人数反而超过了学生数量。【原文：Before Harrow International School New York opened its doors in September, principal Matthew Sipple hoped to enroll 80 students by the end of its inaugural year. So far, there are just 20. The kids are outnumbered by a staff of 26.】

item.title: 黑石加入Anthropic融资轮，持股规模增至10亿美元
item.description: 知情人士透露，黑石集团正加大对人工智能公司Anthropic PBC的投资力度，按该初创企业当前估值，其持股价值已升至约10亿美元。【原文：Blackstone Inc. is increasing its investment in artificial intelligence firm Anthropic PBC, elevating its stake to roughly $1 billion at the startup’s current valuation, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 道明证券称，美国国债拍卖强劲的外需缓解了市场担忧
item.description: 据道明证券利率策略师称，近几个月来，外国投资者在国债拍卖中的份额持续攀升，这缓解了市场对避险资产地位受损及巨额赤字将导致外国投资者撤离的担忧。【原文：Foreign buyers of Treasury debt have been scooping up a growing share of note and bond auctions in recent months, allaying fears that tarnished haven status and large deficits would drive them away, according to interest-rate strategists at TD Securities.】
